tweets.text: I can generate plausible-sounding 5 star reviews of a project I haven‚Äôt even created yet; but I know that doing so is poison to the momentum of actual creation; focus is even more important

As AI makes almost every step of creation easier, it becomes more important to stay disciplined about not skipping ahead before you or your project is ready. Sure you *could* generate those assets, but would they rob you of the joy and creativity of un-aided exploration?

RT @taliaotg: Remember that video of a woman fiercely scolding the NYPD for blocking traffic?

That woman recently had a fresh encounter wi‚Ä¶
made a sweet little PICO-8 game with @biddyfox https://t.co/IzdLbZ0uPJ
he is not yet succeeding but I love his energy, this is exactly what I am looking for https://t.co/NUm4Ml451y
cc @YouTubeCreators @YouTube

lmfao I somehow got a youtube strike for 'spam, deceptive practices, and scams' which took down my livestream - I wonder which part of the election data they thought was a scam lol https://t.co/sONVnfXfFn

Wrapping up for now, got an awesome little proof-of-concept going, and even got candidate headshots for elected legislators rendering. Gonna leave automating race summaries for the next session https://t.co/SfS9qc25Nw
Okay, now we are able to feed 2018 Primary results into GPT-3 and get some pretty good vote summaries, wonder how far we can push this with more data and GPT-3 automation... https://t.co/w2gLzo1m3a
Alright, first few steps are done! We have vote data loaded, sorted, and summed properly in our new Vue app. Next up, gonna work on building data-driven sentences https://t.co/VtBjjYHPtH
Once I get all the votes totaled for each race, I want to build some data-driven-sentences that I can feed into OpenAI as prompts to generate snazzy race summaries

So the rollups are working the way I want them to, sort of‚Äì but the summed vote totals seem incorrect. I want to fix that and then I can move onto figuring out how to automate candidate headshots so I can make head-to-heads of historical promaries

Back in action now, pulling our historical primary data from Datasette and doing some grouping and vote summing with d3.rollup - and now we can show historical election results (unfortunately I only get "part of kings" instead of mappable geography) https://t.co/CrGjmPz7SG
Just discovered I was streaming to /dev/null/ for the past 45 minutes‚Ä¶ this is what I get for taking a long break

Okay, got the data loading in Vue from Datasette! Celebrating by sitting in the sun for a second. When I come back, we are going to see if we can slice and dice our data to show historical primary elections in NY in a way that makes sense, and maybe have GPT-3 summarize them?
@agarcia_me Just got it- I had configured my hosts incorrectly- just shotgun sprayed and it worked https://t.co/OFGE9UvU2I
Once again, CORS is making something that should be easy quite hard- working through the datasette-cors plugin and then hopefully we can get our data loaded https://t.co/2caDwW0zKo
Getting started now, just found some historical NY primary data that we're loading into Datasette https://t.co/UsGObLQWM5
Going live in 15 https://t.co/7DufIFneKL

On today‚Äôs 3PM EST stream: üíæ Getting historical election data into Datasette to use as an API üìà Accessing that API for analysis and viz with Vue+D3 ü§ñ Feeding election data to GPT-3 through OpenAI API for data-driven race summaries
So excited to be doing a livestream with The Robot! We'll be writing code and creating beautiful data visualizations together! Tune in at 3pm EST! https://t.co/7DufIFneKL https://t.co/OyeRy0UMxY
